item.title: 2025 Student Climate Survey Launched
item.description: The 2025 Student Climate Survey launched by email on March 31, 2025. Your honest opinions about campus life—how it impacts your ability to learn and grow, both academically and personally—are important. You will find your personal link to complete the survey in your email from President Schmidt. Our goal is to achieve at least a 50% response rate this year. Please submit the completely anonymous survey by April 25, 2025.

item.title: Do you know RPI’s Mission and Goals?
item.description: Did you know our new Rensselaer Forward Plan carries forward our founder’s mission: to instruct “persons who may choose to apply themselves in the application of science to the common purposes of life”? The mission, vision, and core values of RPI are outlined alongside the former Rensselaer Plan 2024 and the new Rensselaer Forward Plan. For more details, dive into Standard 1 of RPI’s Self-Study for Middle States Accreditation, a team led by Dr. Lee Ligon and Ms. Colleen Smith.

item.title: Out of the Darkness Suicide Prevention Walk | April 6
item.description: Date: Sunday, April 6, 2025 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM - RPI Circle K, in collaboration with the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention, is hosting our third annual Out of the Darkness Suicide Prevention Walk: April 6th on the ’86 Field from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM. Tabling, registration, raffles, entertainment, and more beginning at 10:00 AM. This event aims to raise awareness about suicide prevention and mental health, bringing these critical topics to the forefront of RPI’s campus and the Troy community.

item.title: CBE Seminar Series Continues with Dr. Rajesh Khare | April 2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 2, 2025 9:30 AM - 10:30 AM - The CBE Seminar Series continues with Dr. Rajesh Khare, Professor and Whitacre Department Chair of the Department of Chemical Engineering at Texas Tech. Dr. Khare’s seminar, titled “From Molecules to Rheology: A Journey across Length and Time Scales” is open to all. Refreshments will be available at 9:00 a.m. in the Ricketts’ Coonley Lounge (RI 120).

item.title: Advanced Digital Imaging Spring Exhibition Opening Reception to be held April 8
item.description: The opening reception of Advanced Digital Imaging Spring 2025 Exhibition is on Tuesday April 8, 6 to 7pm in SAGE Lab 5th floor Dean’s Gallery. The exhibition consists of works-in-progress and short study projects created in class in response to studies in gesture, emotion, the human body, virtual and augmented realities, and expanded notions of perception and time. Included in the exhibition are multimedia, photography, archival digital and hand drawn works on paper, canvas, and other materials.

item.title: “Create Reproducible R Environments with renv!” RPIrates Monthly Meeting (Weds, 02 Apr, 6p, AE217)
item.description: RPI R users are invited to the April 2025 meeting of RPIrates: The RPI R Users Group! Our topic for Weds, 02 Apr (6p, AE217) will be “Create Reproducible R Environments with renv!,” led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Director of Research Operations of the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. In this session we’ll learn how R’s renv package can be used to create reproducible R environments that are more isolated, portable and reproducible.

item.title: Do you know RPI’s Student Handbook?
item.description: Did you know that for RPI students, the Student Handbook and Graduate Student Supplement outline academic and disciplinary policies? For faculty and staff, these are detailed in the Human Resources Policy Guidelines and the Faculty Handbook. For more information, explore Standard 2 of RPI’s Self-Study for Middle States Accreditation: Ethics and Integrity, a team led by Dr. Dorit Nevo.

item.title: Rensselaer Faculty and Staff In Person Workshop - Reviewing Supported Polling Tools On Campus for Courses or Meetings | April 7
item.description: Date: Monday, April 7, 2025 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - In this workshop we will take time to look at a couple polling software tools that are available and supported on campus and discuss the differences. The tools we will be discussing include iClicker and Slido. We will also take a quick look at the free version of Kahoot! (not supported on campus with license but fun!). Please register for this workshop by April 4th as space is limited. Please look in the See section for the registration link and more details.

item.title: Call for Faculty Reflective Pedagogy Fellows – Applications due April 11th
item.description:
Inquiry-based learning and creativity are key elements toward creating engaged learning. The Gameful and Immersive Learning Teams invite interested faculty to apply to redesign one of their courses (or a course element). Following the successful spring 2024 Innovative Pedagogy Fellows initiative, the Office of Undergraduate Education is capitalizing on this momentum by funding a professional development opportunity for a new cohort of fellows in 2025, the Reflective Pedagogy Fellows.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
